objective: Reduce superficial sections by enforcing concrete anchors and evidence-driven writing in algorithm articles.
acceptance_criteria: Template requires at least one concrete anchor per major section; workflow adds an anchor pass and anti-fluff rewrite; acceptance checklist flags sections lacking numeric/example/constraint; at least one explicit limitation or counterexample required.
scope_in: Update algorithm-article-writer SKILL workflow/guardrails, template, acceptance criteria, add depth checklist reference, update reinforcement audit.
scope_out: No changes to content posts, themes, or config.
inputs: User feedback citing shallow Background/Motivation, Quick Mastery Map, Mental Model, Core Concepts, Feasibility, Problem Framing, Derivation, Explanation, Steps, Selection Guide.
exit_condition: Drafted edits that add anchor requirements and verification items; ready to move to change step.

failure_mode: Sections read as generic summaries without concrete anchors.
edits: Added depth checklist; updated workflow to include anchor pass and anti-fluff rewrite; strengthened template to require concrete anchors; expanded acceptance criteria with anchor and limitation checks.
why: Force each section to include evidence, numbers, or constraints to avoid superficial prose.
expected_shift: Before: high-level summaries; After: anchored, testable statements with concrete examples.
rollback: Revert commits touching algorithm-article-writer template, skill, and acceptance criteria.

checks_run: scripts/validate_reinforcement_audit.py; manual grep for depth-checklist references and acceptance criteria anchor.
evidence: validate_reinforcement_audit.py passed with python3; rg shows depth-checklist referenced in SKILL.md; acceptance criteria includes anchor requirement.

improvements: Added depth checklist and anchor/anti-fluff workflow gates; template now forces numeric/formula/counterexample anchors; acceptance criteria enforces anchors and explicit limitations.
what_worked: Workflow-level gates plus acceptance criteria make shallow sections fail fast.
risks_tradeoffs: Higher authoring burden; may require more explicit assumptions when data is missing.
next_action: Run a second reinforcement round to add a mandatory 'evidence pass' and a micro-example requirement per section.

objective: Enforce strict reading-time estimation and minimum length by adding a deterministic estimator and expansion gates to prevent short, shallow articles.
acceptance_criteria: Add reading-time estimator reference and script; workflow computes estimate after writing; if estimate < min_required (default 15 min) expand content, not just label; readingTime field matches computed estimate (rounded up) and is never less than estimate; acceptance checklist includes estimator and min-length checks.
scope_in: Update algorithm-article-writer SKILL workflow/guardrails, template and depth checklist, acceptance criteria; add reading-time estimator reference and script; update reinforcement audit.
scope_out: No changes to content posts, themes, or config.
inputs: User request: allow exceeding threshold but not below; strict counting; increase word count to avoid shallow sections.
exit_condition: Estimator and length gates defined; workflow and acceptance criteria updated; ready to change step.

failure_mode: Reading time is overstated and articles are too short.
edits: Added reading-time estimator reference and script; updated workflow to compute estimate and enforce minimum; added acceptance criteria for estimate; added content expansion knobs and depth checklist note.
why: Ensure readingTime is conservative and content expands when below threshold.
expected_shift: Before: readingTime arbitrary; After: computed estimate with minimum-length enforcement.
rollback: Revert changes to estimator script, references, and SKILL workflow.

evidence: validate_reinforcement_audit.py passed; estimator returns minutes=11 for the sample post, indicating the gate would trigger expansion.
metrics_snapshot: Checks pass; estimate computed; below min_required => expansion needed.

improvements: Added a strict estimator and minimum-length gate; verification shows it flags a too-short post and forces expansion.
what_worked: The estimator provides a measurable trigger for expansion and stops under-length readingTime labels.
risks_tradeoffs: More authoring time; requires content expansion discipline instead of padding.
next_action: Apply the new estimator to current draft and expand sections using the expansion knobs to reach the minimum.
